page.title: 12COUNTRY PARK-FLORA & FAUNA.
page.content: 100 ACRES OF TREES AND FLOWERS MAKE UP THE PARK. IT IS SPLIT INTO 2 PARTS. ON 1 SIDE THE SOIL IS PERFECT FOR FLOWERS. ON THE OTHER SIDE, THE SOIL IS ACID AND GORSE AND HEATHER GROWS THERE.{90% OF THE WOOD IS CONIFER. THERE ARE LOTS OF BIRDS IN THE PARK INCLUDING TREECREEPERS, ROBINS, JAYS, GOLDCRESTS AND ALL TITS. MOST OF THE SHRUBS ARE EITHER GORSE, OR IN THE ACID AREA, RHODODENDRON. THERE ARE 2 PONDS, 1 FOR THE FISH AND 1 WITH TADPOLES. MAMMALS FOUND ARE FOX, STOAT, WEASEL, RABBIT AND ROE DEER. THE ONLY SNAKE IN THE PARK IS THE ADDER WHICH IS QUITE COMMON. THE ADDER IS ALSO FOUND IN THE{HOLT LOWES,}AN AREA OF HEATH LAND NEAR THE PARK BUT THE PARK HAS THE MOST. IN SUMMER THERE ARE LOTS OF BUTTERFLIES IN THE DAYTIME AND A GREAT VARIETY OF MOTHS AT NIGHT.
